page.title: 19Education 3: Continued
page.content: The attraction of schools in the area is their position with the sea and the Downs in front and to the East the town. The railway gives easy access from London. The healthy climate is another encouraging factor. In the area there are hardly any State Schools as residential housing used up much of the land at a time before the development of state education. Meads area is also renowned for the large numbers of foreign students who come to the area in the summer in order to learn English.
